channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Jerome Powell to attend Supreme Court oral argument on Lisa Cook’s attempted firing from Federal Reserve
item.description: If Trump succeeds in removing Cook, he could appoint another person to fill her slot, which would give his appointees a majority on the Fed's board.

item.title: How Finland Teaches People to Be Immune to Misinformation
item.description: Rampant misinformation is bad for society. It’s also bad for business. Has Finland found a solution?

item.title: Warren Buffett Says Paying Off Your Credit Cards Is Better Than ‘Any Investment Idea I’ve Got’
item.description: Because the rate of return is guaranteed — and so is the impact on your finances.

item.title: How Tom Holland’s NA Beer Company, Bero, Plans to 3x Revenue During a ‘Difficult Time’
item.description: Paine Schwartz Partners joins the startup’s cap table just in time for Dry January.

item.title: Wall Street is once again banking on the TACO trade because they’ve been ‘burned’ by believing Trump before
item.description: At the time of writing, only 17% of Polymarket betters believe all the tariffs Trump has threatened against Europe will go into effect on February 1. ...

item.title: What are tokenized securities? Risks and what to know as stock exchange NYSE embraces the blockchain
item.description: The blockchain is coming to Wall Street. The New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) said on Monday that it was developing a platform to trade tokenized securi...

item.title: The 2026 Advice I’m Giving Founders, Builders, and Leaders Behind Closed Doors
item.description: These are new table stakes for tech, AI, growth, and sales.

item.title: EU members consider the ‘trade bazooka’ to handle Trump’s tariffs threats over Greenland
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron says the European Union “should not hesitate” to use the trade bloc’s Anti-Coercion Instrument in face of U.S. Presid...

item.title: Most scientific inventions don’t leave the lab. This VC firm is changing that
item.description: While working as an engineer at Tesla, Niccolo Cymbalist never planned to start a business. But he’d been considering an idea for new technology—an au...

item.title: Why Jollibee is turning to a U.S. IPO to fuel global growth
item.description: Global CFO Richard Shin discusses separating Jollibee Foods Corporation's international unit and listing it in the U.S.

item.title: The Fed’s Jerome Powell plans to attend Supreme Court argument on Lisa Cook case, says source
item.description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell will attend the Supreme Court’s oral argument Wednesday in a case involving the attempted firing of Fed governor L...

item.title: Forget the four-day workweek: CEO of the world’s largest workspace provider says it’s not coming, despite what Bill Gates and Elon Musk predict
item.description: Billionaire tech CEOs promise shorter weeks thanks to AI—but IWG’s Mark Dixon says automation won’t free time, it’ll just create more work.

item.title: Trump will talk housing affordability while surrounded by billionaires at World Economic Forum
item.description: President Donald Trump plans to use a key address Wednesday to try to convince Americans he can make housing more affordable , but he’s picked a stran...

item.title: Growth Hurts: The Psychology Behind Founder Evolution
item.description: That pain is not a sign of failure; it can be addressed with identity skills.

item.title: EU chief von der Leyen on Trump: ‘A deal is a deal. And when friends shake hands, it must mean something’
item.description: "We consider the people of the United States not just our allies, but our friends," the European Commission chief said at the World Economic Forum.
